citeinfo.origin: Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) (Data source)
citeinfo.title: CARE_LONG_TERM_FACILITIES_ISDH_IN: Residential Care Facilities, Nursing Homes, and Hospices in Indiana in 2007 (Indiana State Department of Health, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: Phone numbers, addresses, and information regarding type of facility were obtained from Web pages of the Indiana State Department of Health. The directory of hospices was obtained from http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hspcdir/wdirhspc.htm . The directory of long-term care facilities (nursing homes) was obtained from http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/directory/wdirltc.htm . The directory of residential care facilities was obtained from http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/resdir/wdirres.htm . Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey used ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator" and used the "Geocoding" tool to perform address matching, using street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0.

descript.abstract: CARE_LONG_TERM_FACILITIES_ISDH_IN is a point shapefile showing the locations of 86 residential care facilities, 525 long-term care facilities (nursing homes), and 81 hospices included in various directories that appear on Web pages of the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH). Using street addresses from the directory, a shapefile was created using the "Geocoding" tool in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 and street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000 v. 17.0.
descript.purpose: This data set was compiled to create a GIS layer showing locations of residential care facilities, nursing homes, and hospices in Indiana.
descript.supplinf: Indiana State Department of Health Web sites (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hspcdir/wdirhspc.htm , http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/directory/wdirltc.htm , and http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/resdir/wdirres.htm ).

timeperd.current: 2007 Indiana State Department of Health Web site

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 480 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Street addresses and telephone numbers for residential care facilities, nursing homes, and hospices were obtained from the Web site of the Indiana State Department of Health and are assumed to be accurate. Geocoding produced match scores of more than 80 percent for 93 percent of residential care facilities, long-term care facilities (nursing homes), and hospices. Locations of other facilities with match scores that are less than 80 percent were plotted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap version 9.2, together with information obtained from Google searches, MapQuest (http://www.mapquest.com/maps/ ), and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were made.
dataqual.complete: All residential care facilities, long-term care facilites (nursing homes), and hospices listed by the Indiana State Department of Health were included.

horizpa.horizpar: For match scores greater than 80 percent, plotted locations are generally within several hundred feet of actual locations. For match scores less than 80 percent, horizontal positional accuracy is unknown, so plotted locations may differ from actual locations by large distances.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

srcinfo.srccontr: Addresses and phone numbers of hospitals
Addresses and phone numbers of rural health clinics
Addresses and phone numbers of rural health clinics

citeinfo.title: Dynamap 2000
citeinfo.othercit: Indiana roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0, licensed to the Indiana Geological Survey

srcinfo.srccitea: Indiana roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0
srcinfo.srccontr: Indiana streets and roads suitable for geocoding

procstep.procdesc: The addresses, telephone numbers, and other information for each residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), and hospice was compiled by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from directories available on the Web site of the Indiana State Department of Health. The address list for residential care facilites was saved as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "RESIDENTIAL_CARE.XLS." The address list for long-term care facilites was saved as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "LONGTERM_CARE.XLS." The address list for hospices was saved as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "HOSPICES.XLS."
procstep.srcused: ISDH Residential Care Directory (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/resdir/wdirres.htm); ISDH Long-Term Care Facility Directory (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/directory/wdirltc.htm), and ISDH Hospice Directory (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hspcdir/wdirhspc.htm).

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel used street information licensed from Tele Atlas in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator." Using the "Geocoding" tool to perform address matching, RESIDENTIAL_CARE.XLS, LONGTERM_CARE.XLS, and HOSPICES.XLS were address- matched. A total of 664 facilities were automatically matched to known addresses. In addition, twenty-eight (28) facilities needed to be manually plotted using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap, together with locations obtained using Google searches, MapQuest, and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. The output was saved as CARE_LONG_TERM_FACILITIES_ISDH_IN.SHP.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

edom.edomvd: Originally "unmatched" address in batch geocoding. Subsequently plotted by personnel of the IGS.

attr.attrdef: In geocoding, a value (match score) is assigned to all potential candidates for an address match. The match score is based on how well the location found in the reference data matches with the address data being searched. The top score (best match) is 100.
Name of residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice, as obtained from the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH)
Street address of residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice, as obtained from directory of the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH)
Street address of residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice that was used in geocoding process
City in which residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice is located
Zip-code for residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice that was used in the geocoding process
Phone number of residential care facility, long-term care facility (nursing home), or hospice, as obtained from a directory of the Indians State Department of Health (ISDH)
Type of facility. Types include RESIDENTIAL CARE FACILITY, NURSING HOME, and HOSPICE.
Total bed capacity of a facility. A value of -9999 indicates that no data are available.

Number of beds of various types in residential care facilities and long-term care (nursing home) facilities. Types include NF (number of Medicaid Title 19 beds), SNF (number of Medicare Title 18 beds), SNF/NF (number of Medicaid/Medicare Title 18/19 beds), NCC (number of noncertified comprehensive beds not reimbursed by Medicare and (or) Medicaid), and RES (number of residential beds).
attr.attrdefs: Indiana State Department of Health, Web site http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/ltc/profile/define.htm .

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
